Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; traces of possibly two added white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Naukratis, Possibly Site 28 (Petrie) [based on pencil mark]
Curator's comments: The number '29 (b)' , '9' uncertain, is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. Many kantharoi Type B (See Williams 1983, 169) have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p.169, no. 164, pl. 35, no. 17)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 729, no. 889)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1855) (phase 2)
